ratings.comment: Genuinely, Dr. Frank is the best professor I've ever had. Her lectures make me excited to go to an 8 am. I feel like I've learned so much!! She cares so much about her students and will do her best to make everyone understand the course material. This class is NOT politicized. We don't know her personal beliefs because she shares objective facts.

I've never been excited to get up and go to an 8 a.m. lecture all the way across campus. For this class, I am. I love Frankie and her informational lectures that cover pertinent topics, and I love how she makes each lecture feel super interesting and fun. I'm going to be taking more classes with her, for sure.
Took Women and Law this summer and I'm taking a seminar with her now. She really cares about und

Frankie is my favorite professor! She makes class fun, she listens and she is available when needed. She is honest and direct. On day one, she lays out her expectations and those who read the syllabus succeed in her class. Frankie makes learning fun and she truly cares about her students in a way I have never experienced. Frankie for Pres!

I had spent 11 weeks investing my everything into this course, attending every lecture, reading everything, and otherwise performing excellently. Once receiving a poor grade on an essay outline and asking instructor Frank for opportunities to improve, none were given. Frank is unhelpful and values her reputation more than the academic process.

Frankie is an amazing instructor. She convinces students to care about her subject topics and is impactful on students' lives outside the classroom. She assigns a lot of reading, but her exams are open book and online, which means that you will have access to readings during exams if you didn't read them fully.

Frankie is one of the best professors I've ever had! She replies to questions very quickly and is willing to meet with you outside of class and offers awesome feedback. Her lectures are so fun and engaging and her assessments are fairly easy if you do the reading and attend lectures and take notes. Will be taking another one of her classes.

Frankie is an incredible instructor. She truly cares about her students and what she is teaching, making this class so much fun to take. Even though the class was completely online, I absolutely loved it. The "Before the Courts" Project was super fun and Frankie lets you do any kind of project you can think of on any topic that you want.

Frankie is by far my favorite professor I've ever had. She genuinely cares about teaching all the subjects she covers, and she does a really great job of creating a positive learning environment (even with the online format). The class is an "easy A" if you actually engage with the lectures, assignments, and reading materials.

Frankie is one of the best professors that I've had at Madison. I took Women and the Law online during summer term, and it was an amazing decision. Frankie is caring, knowledgable, and kind. The topics we discussed were incredibly interesting and relevant. The grading and workload were appropriate. Highly recommend taking a course with her!

I love this class. Frankie somehow makes online classes engaging and she offers so much time outside of lecture to her students. I learned early to actually watch the lectures. She does them live but records then which is great. 3 tests open note with several days to complete. 1 final project. Discussion posts were actually meaningful.

I took Law and Sexuality as one of my last at Madison and it has been the best class ever. Even when moving to online format admidst a pandemic, Frankie has been amazing and more compassionate than any of my other profs. The content is great, one research paper, 3 online tests, participation. I would take this class again in a minute.

Frankie makes herself available at all times, truly encourages you to educate and challenge yourself, has you consider things you haven't before, and genuinely cares for each and every student she has. Only prof who has ever learned almost all of her students name in the class and keeps the class light and hilarious with great jokes.

Frankies classes are the best. Shes finishing her phd but shes better than any professor Ive had here. She makes legal studies fun and approachable for non majors. Take this class its amazing and you talk about all the aspects of sex in the legal world. Im loving it. 3 online tests open book, 1 research paper.

Frankie is an amazing lecturer. She truly wants to get to know who you are and she wants everyone to succeed. I recommend this class to everyone I talk to and you would be lucky to have her as your instructor. Tips about the class: show up. If you come to class everything else will come easy. One of the top lecturers at UW, so take this class!

Frankie is my absolute favorite professor so far here at UW. She is hilarious, personable, and makes lecture SO entertaining. Half of your grade will be participation points, so go to lecture, but honestly it's so enjoyable! I'm not sure how she does it, but she knows most to all of her students by name even though theres so many of us. Love her!

Frankie is one of the chillest professors you will ever have. The material is easy to understand and she really cares about her students. There are 3 online assessments that are open note and open book which you have 5 full days to take and 2 papers which you have 2 weeks to complete. Participation is 50% of the grade. Grading is super fair.

Took marriage and family with Frankie and it was a great class. Two short reflection papers and 3 online assessments that are open note open book takes the pressure off big exams. She's a cool prof. and is welcoming to everybody. how many professors know all their students' names with 100 people in the class? Taking her again in the fall.

Frankie was the best instructor I ever had at UW Madison, even when she was a teaching assistant. She clearly cares about her students and their success both in school and in life. She always made time to meet with me and do review sessions and her grading was fair and clear. Also, she's hilarious and honest -- I would take any class she taught.
